Ever thought why 10k applicants for one role ? ( p.s. the reason is not just India being overpopulus)

posts.content:
Avtar, an organisation which works for diversity and inclusivity in the workplace conducted surveys of 1500 women in each 120 cities. 

The study is mostly based on secondary research and is based on two scores - Social Inclusion Score (SIS) and Industry Inclusion Score (IIS).

Factors where Chennai fell behind Bengaluru include skilling and employment and caregiving support. Chennai stayed ahead in terms of infrastructure and quality of life.

Via

Read:

comments.commentText: Good to hear, but never ever believe these reports.
Wrong, in South,only Hyderabad is the best city for women ,as it has the world's first all women police force "SHE"

posts.name:
Prasanth Nair
Prasanth Nair
posts.content:
At the outset, let me wish you and your loved ones a Happy and Prosperous 2025. May all your dreams come true.

Wanted to share my thoughts on HR landscape for 2025. The top 5 trends that I see are:
1. Integration AI in HR: AI has already entered workplace, but the penetration has not been substantial with the use largely focused on query handling, summarization and analysis of data points including basic level-1 of prediction. Going forward, AI in HR will be used for taking ‚Äúaction‚Äù based on analysis, comparison of options and choosing the right options given the boundary objectives. This will see a re-configuration of roles and capabilities. For example, right now AI usage is about telling me number of leaves that I have, after going through my leave record. Next usage will be agent driven by AI applying for leave after looking at data of ‚Äúleaves‚Äù of other co-workers so as to ensure work continuity.
2. Health ‚Äì physical and mental: We are already witnessing increase in ailments. We will see increase in physical and mental ailments including fatigue, obesity, lifestyle diseases, anxiety and sleep related disorders. Organizations need to keep employee health as the core focus of their people strategy and then actively work towards managing the controllable.

3. K shaped Compensation: K shaped compensation refers to growing disparity in pay and benefits within organizations depending on certain skills which are experiencing significant growth in compensation while others are stagnating. This is driven by the demand -supply gap for certain skills in the market. Organizations need to make sure that critical talent are retained and compensation are in sync with the market.

4. Talent Networks: We will see increasing trend of ‚Äònon employees‚Äô working closely with employees to create value. Gig employees is one of the manifestation of ‚Äònon employees‚Äô there could be others like consumers, independent work groups, integrated back end and so on. Organizations need to explore how such talent networks can be leveraged for value creation.
5. Buddy Leader: We have seen lot of examples of Superstar Leader. There is also lot of talk of ‚ÄòServant leaders‚Äô. But the future belongs to leaders who can be ‚ÄòBuddy leaders‚Äô ‚Äì those who don‚Äôt believe in power distance and operate as buddies, but at the same time able to influence the course of action. What's the leadership style in your organization ? Try to encourage Buddy Leadership.

These are the 5 trends that I see in HR in 2025. Happy to expand and explain (on direct basis).
Happy New Year!

comments.commentText: Excellent insights on the evolving HR landscape! The "Buddy Leader" concept resonates deeply ‚Äì fostering collaboration and trust is key to navigating future challenges. I'm particularly interested in the implications of AI-driven action in HR; how can we ensure ethical considerations and prevent bias in these automated decisions? Looking forward to further discussion.

posts.content:
Hello LinkedIn Family ISO: 

I'm looking to hire an Executive Assistant/Virtual Assistant personally. I've had a couple of incredible team members and I've realized the value and importance of having someone who has the capabilities of helping me navigate my fast paced professional life!

Looking for someone with the following capabilities:
- Extremely Organized - can navigate multiple projects at the same time
- Good with Customer/Client Experience
- Tech Savvy (Not just Tech Dependent)
- Fast Learner
- Marketing Background would be amazing
- Driven to learn and grow.

I'd prefer to have someone in the Eastern Idaho region, but could be remote. Let me know if you know of someone! TIA
